item.title: Groovy collect vs spread-dot operator
item.description: Yesterday I was doing some Groovy code cleanup with the wonderful CodeNarc static analysis tool. One of the violations it found was UnnecessaryCollectCall. The summary of the rule is “Some method calls to Object.collect(Closure) can be replaced with the spread operator.” e.g. Replace things.collect { it.name } with things*.name, or even things.name if what you’re after is a property. But when I performed that refactoring and ran all the tests, some failed!
